column4: In Synaptic, advanced mode, status.  What does "Local or Obsolete" mean?  I don't see anything about it in the manual, the synaptic website, nor the ubuntu web site.
means packages that are known by the APT system, but don't appear in the repositories, i think
so, it's either packages that *used* to be in the reps but aren't anymore, or packages that you installed manually from outside the reps
hmmm ... I installed emacs using apt-get, rather than synaptics.  Would that cause it?
no
because those are precisely the packages appearing in that list.
perhaps the names have been changed recently? what are the packages called?
emacs21, emacs21-bin-common, emacs21-common, emacsen-common and xaw3dg
not sure about it, those *are* the current names
hence my question.
OK, I just noticed that aptitude lists what "Local or Obsolete" means, but I don't see why it applys to those.  Weird.
I found the problem with the packages.  Apparently, Ubuntu does not support emacs.  It is only available if you enable the Universe repository, which I don't normally enable.
emacs21 is in main for me
look at your repository configuration.  if you have universe enabled, remove it.  After the update, tell me if emacs is still present under editors.  It disappears for me.
still there for me
Weird ... I've done a reload of the repositories, and emacs only appears if and only if I have universe enabled, but then it shows up in the main area.
sounds like a synaptic quirk to me...
possibly.  aptitude shows the same.  I haven't looked to see if they are related.  Aptitude appears to be a curses version of synaptics.
I'll be doing a clean install, anyway.  see what happens.  Right now, I bootstrapped from the ubuntu provided VMware image.
at best, synaptic is a GUI version of aptitude... i don't know if synaptic has started using aptitude's database yet, but i heard it was going to
ah, didn't mean to reverse polarity  ;-)
do you have the ubuntu cd in your sources.list?  I wonder if that's my problem.  I wonder if I need to add a non-CD main.

Thanks for your help.  I got it resolved.  I had the first of these too in /etc/apt/sources.list, and had to add the second: deb cdrom:[Ubuntu 5.10 _Breezy Badger_ - Release i386 (20051012)] / breezy main restricted
